speaker: KENT
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the heath. Storm still.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter KING LEAR and Fool

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You cataracts and hurricanoes, spout

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Till you have drench'd our steeples, drown'd the cocks!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You sulphurous and thought-executing fires,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Vaunt-couriers to oak-cleaving thunderbolts,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Singe my white head! And thou, all-shaking thunder,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Smite flat the thick rotundity o' the world!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Crack nature's moulds, an germens spill at once,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That make ingrateful man!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: O nuncle, court holy-water in a dry

speaker: Fool
text_entry: house is better than this rain-water out o' door.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Good nuncle, in, and ask thy daughters' blessing:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: here's a night pities neither wise man nor fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Rumble thy bellyful! Spit, fire! spout, rain!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nor rain, wind, thunder, fire, are my daughters:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I tax not you, you elements, with unkindness;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I never gave you kingdom, call'd you children,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You owe me no subscription: then let fall

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your horrible pleasure: here I stand, your slave,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A poor, infirm, weak, and despised old man:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But yet I call you servile ministers,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That have with two pernicious daughters join'd

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your high engender'd battles 'gainst a head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: So old and white as this. O! O! 'tis foul!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that has a house to put's head in has a good

speaker: Fool
text_entry: head-piece.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The cod-piece that will house

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Before the head has any,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The head and he shall louse;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: So beggars marry many.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The man that makes his toe

speaker: Fool
text_entry: What he his heart should make

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Shall of a corn cry woe,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And turn his sleep to wake.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For there was never yet fair woman but she made

speaker: Fool
text_entry: mouths in a glass.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, I will be the pattern of all patience;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will say nothing.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter KENT

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Marry, here's grace and a cod-piece; that's a wise

speaker: Fool
text_entry: man and a fool.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Alas, sir, are you here? things that love night

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Love not such nights as these; the wrathful skies

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Gallow the very wanderers of the dark,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And make them keep their caves: since I was man,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such sheets of fire, such bursts of horrid thunder,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Such groans of roaring wind and rain, I never

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Remember to have heard: man's nature cannot carry

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The affliction nor the fear.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let the great gods,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That keep this dreadful pother o'er our heads,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Find out their enemies now. Tremble, thou wretch,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That hast within thee undivulged crimes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Unwhipp'd of justice: hide thee, thou bloody hand;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou perjured, and thou simular man of virtue

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That art incestuous: caitiff, to pieces shake,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That under covert and convenient seeming

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hast practised on man's life: close pent-up guilts,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Rive your concealing continents, and cry

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: These dreadful summoners grace. I am a man

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: More sinn'd against than sinning.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Alack, bare-headed!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Gracious my lord, hard by here is a hovel;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Some friendship will it lend you 'gainst the tempest:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Repose you there; while I to this hard house--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: More harder than the stones whereof 'tis raised;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which even but now, demanding after you,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Denied me to come in--return, and force

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Their scanted courtesy.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My wits begin to turn.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come on, my boy: how dost, my boy? art cold?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I am cold myself. Where is this straw, my fellow?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The art of our necessities is strange,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That can make vile things precious. Come,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: your hovel.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Poor fool and knave, I have one part in my heart

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That's sorry yet for thee.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that has and a little tiny wit--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,--

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Must make content with his fortunes fit,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For the rain it raineth every day.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: True, my good boy. Come, bring us to this hovel.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR and KENT

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This is a brave night to cool a courtezan.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I'll speak a prophecy ere I go:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When priests are more in word than matter;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When brewers mar their malt with water;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When nobles are their tailors' tutors;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No heretics burn'd, but wenches' suitors;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When every case in law is right;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No squire in debt, nor no poor knight;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When slanders do not live in tongues;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nor cutpurses come not to throngs;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: When usurers tell their gold i' the field;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And bawds and whores do churches build;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then shall the realm of Albion

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come to great confusion:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then comes the time, who lives to see't,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That going shall be used with feet.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: This prophecy Merlin shall make; for I live before his time.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Exit
